title: Protects children in N.Y. city from child abuse and maltreatment in educational settings
summary: Includes pupils from school districts within a city having a population of one million or more within the definition of child for the purposes of their protection from abuse and maltreatment in educational settings.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2417

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. HEASTIE -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CLARK,
         P. LOPEZ, TOWNS -- read once and referred to the Committee  on  Educa-
         tion

       AN  ACT to amend the education law, in relation to including pupils from
         school districts within a city having a population of one  million  or
         more  within  the  definition  of  child  for  the  purposes  of their
         protection from abuse and maltreatment in educational settings

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  2  of  section 1125 of the education law, as
    2  added by chapter 180 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
    3    2. "Child" shall mean a person  under  the  age  of  twenty-one  years
    4  enrolled  in  a  school  district  in  this  state[, other than a school
    5  district within a city having a population of one million or more].
    6    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01332-01-1
